prop.name: priceSpecification
prop.desc: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

prop.name: price
prop.desc:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

  • Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

Action.name: result
Action.desc: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote a book.

Action.name: actionStatus
Action.desc: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

Action.name: target
Action.desc: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

Action.name: agent
Action.desc: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. John wrote a book.

Action.name: startTime
Action.desc:
The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

Action.name: endTime
Action.desc:
The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

Action.name: instrument
Action.desc: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with a pen.

Action.name: participant
Action.desc: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with Steve.

Action.name: object
Action.desc: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read a book.

Action.name: error
Action.desc: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

Action.name: location
Action.desc: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.
